intro: Pentadesma lecomteana, commonly known as the Lecomte's pentadesma, is a tropical plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
